front.title: Reverse DNS Naming Convention for CIDR Address Blocks

abstract.t: The reverse DNS naming method is used to specify a complete IP address. At present there is no standard way for the reverse DNS to handle address ranges. As an example, there is no formal mechanism to define a reverse DNS name for the block of addresses specified by the IPv4 prefix 129.82.0.0/16. Defining such a reverse DNS naming convention would be useful for a number of applications. This draft proposes a naming convention for encoding CIDR address blocks into the reverse DNS namespace.
